justifications: The EU can and should retain a hard line against Russia's aggression on the continent.

Blaming Brexit for a softening stance on Russia is exactly the sort of thing a group of nations with deep business interests in Russia and little stomach for continuing to stand up to aggressive behavior might do.
The EU will close ranks and seek ever more political integration-all the while blaming Brexit for problems of its own making.
The UK's decision should be a stark wake-up call.

references: special relationship has a chance to grow stronger post-Brexit

justifications: For the UK, the special relationship has a chance to grow stronger post-Brexit.

Blaming Brexit for a softening stance on Russia is exactly the sort of thing a group of nations with deep business interests in Russia and little stomach for continuing to stand up to aggressive behavior might do.
For the UK, the special relationship has a chance to grow stronger post-Brexit. That would certainly mark Brexit a loss for Putin's regime.
The UK's voice was more often than not drowned out, overruled and ignored in EU institutions.
